JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively . They both live in PERSON , GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicants own a semi - detached house in PERSON . In DATE their house was considerably damaged by flooding . Subsequently , the applicants intended to build an extension to their house . Under the domestic law they were required to obtain a planning permission and subsequently a construction permit . They instituted administrative proceedings with a view to obtaining these decisions .

On DATE the applicants applied to the Mayor of ORG ) for a planning permission ( decyzja o warunkach zabudowy i zagospodarowania terenu ) for the intended extension of their house . On DATE the Mayor granted them the permission . The applicants’ neighbour appealed against that decision .
On DATE the ORG ( PERSON ) quashed the Mayor ’s decision and remitted the case .

On DATE the Mayor granted the applicants a DATE valid planning permission . The applicants’ neighbour appealed . On DATE ORG of Appeal upheld the Mayor ’s decision . The applicants’ neighbour filed an appeal against that decision with the administrative court . On DATE ORG quashed ORG decision of DATE and remitted the case .

On DATE ORG re - examined an appeal lodged by the applicants’ neighbour . It found that the appeal proceedings were devoid of purpose since the planning permission had meanwhile lost its validity . The applicants’ neighbour again filed an appeal against that decision with the administrative court .
On DATE ORG quashed ORG decision of DATE and remitted the case .
On DATE ORG quashed the Mayor ’s decision of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case . The applicants and their neighbour lodged appeals against that decision with the administrative court .
On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal lodged by the applicants’ neighbour . On DATE it discontinued the proceedings in respect of the applicants’ appeal since they had withdrawn it .

In the meantime , on DATE the PERSON Mayor issued a new planning permission for the applicants . The permission remained valid until DATE . On DATE ORG upheld the Mayor ’s decision . The applicants’ neighbour filed an appeal against that decision with the administrative court . On DATE that ORG Wojewódzki Sąd Administracyjny ) quashed ORG decision of DATE and remitted the case .
On DATE ORG of Appeal partly quashed part of the Mayor ’s decision of DATE , remitted the case and partly discontinued the proceedings .

On DATE the applicants applied for a construction permit ( pozwolenie na budowę ) for the extension of their house . On DATE the Head of ORG ( ORG ) granted them the construction permit . The ORG neighbour appealed against that decision . On DATE the PERSON Governor ( Wojewoda ) quashed the decision and remitted the case .
On DATE the Head of ORG again granted a construction permit to the applicants . The applicants’ neighbour appealed . On DATE the PERSON Governor upheld the ORG decision .
On DATE the ORG neighbour filed an appeal against the Governor ’s decision with ORG . On DATE ORG quashed the decision and remitted the case to the GPE .
On DATE the Lubuski Governor quashed the Head of ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case to the first - instance administrative authority .
On DATE the Mayor of ORG ) granted the applicants a construction permit . The applicants’ neighbour appealed . However , on DATE the Lubuski Governor upheld the Mayor ’s decision .

Subsequently , the applicants’ neighbour filed an appeal against that decision with ORG and applied for a stay of execution . On DATE the court decided that the execution of the Governor ’s decision of CARDINAL DATE should be stayed .
On DATE the applicants requested ORG to accelerate the examination of the case .
On DATE ORG quashed the Governor ’s decision of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case to that authority .

On DATE the Lubuski Governor upheld the Mayor of the FAC decision of DATE granting a construction permit to the applicants . The ORG neighbour filed an appeal against that decision with the administrative court . On DATE the ORG ruled that the execution of the Governor ’s decision of DATE should be stayed .
On DATE the Lubuski Governor requested the court to accelerate the examination of the appeal .

On DATE ORG quashed the Governor ’s decision of DATE . It stressed that the Governor ’s decision granting a construction permit to the applicants could not have been issued as the validity of the planning permission had expired in the meantime .
On DATE the PERSON Governor quashed the Mayor of the GPE LOC decision of DATE and remitted the case .

On DATE the Mayor of the Nowa Sól District granted a construction permit to the applicants . On DATE the Lubuski Governor dismissed the appeal of the applicants’ neighbour against the decision of DATE .
On an unspecified date the ORG neighbour filed an appeal against the Governor ’s decision with the administrative court . Subsequently , the ORG became competent to examine the appeal .
On DATE the ORG quashed the Governor ’s decision of DATE and remitted the case .
On DATE the PERSON Governor quashed the Mayor of the FAC Sól District ’s decision of DATE and remitted the case .
On DATE the Mayor of the Nowa Sól District granted a construction permit to the applicants . The applicants’ neighbour appealed .
On DATE the Lubuski Governor upheld the decision of the Mayor of the Nowa Sól District .
On DATE , the Gorzów Wielkopolski ORG quashed both decisions ( of CARDINAL DATE and DATE ) . It is not clear whether the applicants filed a cassation appeal with ORG against this judgment .

The relevant domestic law concerning inactivity on the part of administrative authorities is described in the ORG ’s judgments in cases PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , DATE , and PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , DATE .

As regards the remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings , in particular the applicable provisions of LAW , they are described in the ORG ’s decisions in cases of ORG v. GPE no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( dec . ) , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL-V and NORP v. GPE no . CARDINAL ( dec . ) , ORG CARDINAL-VIII and the judgment in the case of ORG v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL-V.
